questions.passage: The platypus is one of nature's most unusual creatures. A semi-aquatic mammal native to eastern Australia, it is one of the five extant species of monotremes, the only mammals that lay eggs instead of giving birth to live young. Along with its distinctive bill, which resembles that of a duck, the platypus has webbed feet and a tail like a beaver's.
questions.question: What is the main idea of the text?
options: The platypus is a mammal that lays eggs.
The platypus has a unique combination of features.
Monotremes are a rare type of mammal.
questions.answer: The platypus has a unique combination of features.

questions.passage: The artist was known for her meticulous attention to detail. Every brushstroke was deliberate, every color choice was considered, and the final composition was always a testament to her painstaking process.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word 'meticulous' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: The team practiced for weeks, honing their skills and strategy. ______, they were confident they would win the championship game.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.passage: The solar system has eight planets ______ Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: Photosynthesis is the process by which green plants use sunlight, water, and carbon dioxide to create their own food. The process produces oxygen as a byproduct, which is essential for most life on Earth. Without photosynthesis, the planet's atmosphere would not be able to support complex life forms.
questions.question: Which choice best describes a result of photosynthesis mentioned in the text?
options: The release of oxygen into the atmosphere.
questions.answer: The release of oxygen into the atmosphere.

questions.passage: The following text is from a review of a new restaurant. 'The appetizers were a revelation, particularly the seared scallops with a citrus reduction. The main course, a duck confit, was executed with technical perfection, though it lacked a certain innovative spark. Dessert, however, was a letdown; the chocolate lava cake was overcooked and dry.'
questions.question: What is the main purpose of the text?
options: To recommend the restaurant to all diners.
To provide a balanced critique of a meal.
To praise the restaurant's dessert menu.
questions.answer: To provide a balanced critique of a meal.

questions.passage: The collection of paintings, which includes masterpieces from several different artistic periods, ______ scheduled to be displayed in the new wing of the museum.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: A student is writing an argumentative essay claiming that schools should implement later start times for high school students. Which of the following statements provides the most effective evidence to support the student's claim?
questions.question: Which claim is most effective?
options: A personal anecdote about how tired the student feels in their first-period class.
A study from the American Academy of Pediatrics that links later school start times to improved student health, academic performance, and safety.
An interview with a teacher who prefers the current school schedule.
A general statement that teenagers need more sleep than adults.
questions.answer: A study from the American Academy of Pediatrics that links later school start times to improved student health, academic performance, and safety.

questions.passage: Each of the committee members must cast ______ vote before the end of the day to ensure the proposal can move forward.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The Mojave Desert, characterized by its extreme temperatures and scarce rainfall, is home to a surprising variety of life. Plants like the Joshua tree have extensive root systems to capture moisture, while animals such as the kangaroo rat have adapted to survive without drinking water, obtaining all the moisture they need from the seeds they eat.
questions.question: What can be inferred from the text about life in the Mojave Desert?
options: It is easy for most plants and animals to survive there.
There is no water at all in the desert.
Organisms living there have developed special adaptations to cope with the harsh conditions.
The Joshua tree is the only plant that can grow in the Mojave.
questions.answer: Organisms living there have developed special adaptations to cope with the harsh conditions.

questions.passage: Text 1: Historian A argues that the primary cause of the fall of the Roman Empire was a series of internal weaknesses, including political instability, economic decay, and social unrest. These factors, she contends, made the empire vulnerable to external pressures that it might otherwise have withstood. Text 2: Historian B posits that while internal issues were a factor, the decisive blow came from the relentless and increasingly sophisticated barbarian invasions. The sheer military pressure on the frontiers, according to Historian B, was the ultimate cause of the collapse.
questions.question: How does Historian B's perspective relate to Historian A's?
options: Historian B completely rejects Historian A's argument.
Historian B builds upon Historian A's argument by adding more detail.
Historian B offers a different emphasis, focusing on external factors as more decisive than the internal ones Historian A highlights.
Historian B provides a specific example of the political instability mentioned by Historian A.
questions.answer: Historian B offers a different emphasis, focusing on external factors as more decisive than the internal ones Historian A highlights.

questions.passage: An effective leader must possess not only the vision to set a clear direction and the charisma to inspire their team, but also ______ to make difficult decisions under pressure.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The study's conclusion that the new drug is effective is ______ by the fact that the sample size was extremely small and the control group was not properly randomized, making it impossible to rule out the influence of confounding variables.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

questions.passage: Covered in mud, the dog was given a bath by the owner.
questions.question: Which of the following is the best revision of the sentence?
options: The sentence is correct as is.
After weeks of intense research, the scientist finally found the solution to the complex problem.
The solution to the complex problem was finally found by the scientist after weeks of intense research.
Finally finding the solution, the scientist had been researching for weeks.
questions.answer: After weeks of intense research, the scientist finally found the solution to the complex problem.

questions.passage: The author's prose is characterized by its labyrinthine sentences, replete with arcane vocabulary and esoteric allusions. While intellectually stimulating for some, this style can render the text inaccessible to a general audience, creating a barrier to the widespread dissemination of the author's otherwise insightful ideas.
questions.question: Which word best describes the author's tone in this passage?

questions.passage: Bees play a vital role in agriculture as pollinators. As they travel from flower to flower to collect nectar, they transfer pollen, which is necessary for many plants to produce fruits and seeds. It is estimated that one-third of the food consumed by humans relies on pollination by bees.
questions.question: What is the main function of bees described in the text?

questions.passage: Despite the storm's ferocity, the old lighthouse remained steadfast, its powerful beam cutting through the darkness.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'steadfast' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: The students project was a success it received the highest grade in the class.
questions.question: Which choice best corrects the punctuation error in the sentence?

questions.passage: The rise of streaming services has fundamentally altered the entertainment industry. Traditional cable subscriptions have declined, while content production has skyrocketed. However, this has also led to a fragmented market, with consumers needing multiple subscriptions to access all the shows they want to watch.
questions.question: What can be inferred about the impact of streaming services?
options: They have made television cheaper for everyone.
They have created both new opportunities and new challenges for consumers.
They have led to a decrease in the quality of television shows.
They are less popular than traditional cable.
questions.answer: They have created both new opportunities and new challenges for consumers.

questions.passage: By the time the rescue team arrived, the hikers ______ a fire and set up a temporary shelter.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The politician's speech was a masterclass in equivocation. He deftly sidestepped every direct question with vague platitudes and appeals to emotion, leaving the audience with the impression of agreement without committing to any specific policy. It was a performance that was simultaneously impressive in its rhetorical skill and disheartening in its lack of substance.
questions.question: The author's tone can best be described as

questions.question: Which word best completes the sentence?

questions.passage: A flock of birds ______ flying south for the winter.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: Many people believe that creativity is an innate talent. ______, recent studies suggest that it is a skill that can be developed and enhanced through consistent practice and specific techniques.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.passage: The lawyer advised her client to not only prepare for the main arguments but also to be ready for any unexpected questions the judge might ask, essentially telling her to prepare for ______.
questions.question: Which idiomatic expression best completes the sentence?

questions.passage: The old library was a sanctuary for book lovers, a quiet haven where one could escape the hustle and bustle of the city.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'sanctuary' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: The storm was intense ______ however, the house, built on a solid foundation, withstood the powerful winds.
questions.question: Which choice best corrects the punctuation error in the sentence?

questions.passage: The essay begins by posing a provocative question. It then explores three historical case studies that offer different perspectives on the question. It concludes not with a definitive answer, but with a nuanced synthesis of the case studies, suggesting that the answer is complex and context-dependent.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the text's organizational structure?
options: An introduction of a thesis followed by supporting evidence.
An inquiry-based exploration leading to a complex conclusion.
questions.answer: An inquiry-based exploration leading to a complex conclusion.

questions.passage: The water cycle describes the continuous movement of water on, above, and below the surface of the Earth. The main processes involved are evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection. Water evaporates from the surface, condenses into clouds, falls back to Earth as precipitation, and collects in rivers, lakes, and oceans to start the cycle anew.
questions.question: Which process is NOT mentioned as a main part of the water cycle in the text?

questions.passage: Research has shown a strong correlation between regular exercise and improved mental health. A 2019 study published in The Lancet Psychiatry found that individuals who exercised for 45 minutes three to five times a week had 1.5 fewer days of poor mental health per month than those who did not exercise. The study analyzed data from 1.2 million adults in the United States.
questions.question: Which finding is explicitly supported by the text?
options: Exercise is the only way to improve mental health.
All forms of exercise have the same effect on mental health.
A large-scale study linked regular exercise to a measurable decrease in days of poor mental health.
The study was only conducted on professional athletes.
questions.answer: A large-scale study linked regular exercise to a measurable decrease in days of poor mental health.

questions.passage: Covered in mud, the dog was given a bath by the owner.
questions.question: Which of the following is the best revision of the sentence?
options: The sentence is correct as is.
The owner gave the dog, which was covered in mud, a bath.
The bath was given to the dog by the owner, covered in mud.
Covered in mud, the owner gave the dog a bath.
questions.answer: The owner gave the dog, which was covered in mud, a bath.

questions.passage: The museum is free to the public. ______, it is a popular destination for school field trips.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.passage: The new law was designed to be a panacea for the city's economic woes, but critics argued that its effects would be limited and that it failed to address the root causes of unemployment.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'panacea' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: Text 1: Shakespeare's 'Hamlet' is a tragedy driven by individual character flaws, primarily Hamlet's indecisiveness and melancholy. His inability to act decisively on his desire for revenge leads directly to the play's catastrophic conclusion. The external political situation in Denmark is merely a backdrop for this internal, psychological drama. Text 2: To view 'Hamlet' solely as a psychological drama is to miss its profound political dimension. The play is deeply concerned with issues of succession, legitimacy, and the health of the state. Hamlet's personal crisis is inseparable from the political crisis in Denmark; his inaction is not just a personal failing but a symptom of a diseased political body.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the relationship between the two texts?
options: Text 2 offers a supporting example for the argument made in Text 1.
Text 2 challenges the primary focus of Text 1's interpretation.
Text 1 and Text 2 discuss two different Shakespearean plays.
Text 1 summarizes the plot of Hamlet, while Text 2 analyzes its themes.
questions.answer: Text 2 challenges the primary focus of Text 1's interpretation.

questions.passage: My three favorite hobbies are reading hiking and cooking.
questions.question: Which choice best corrects the punctuation error in the sentence?

questions.passage: The results of the recent survey, which were published in a major scientific journal, ______ that a majority of respondents support the new environmental policy.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The award was given to my colleague and ______, in recognition of our collaborative work on the project.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The Amazon rainforest is often called the 'lungs of the planet' because it produces more than 20% of the world's oxygen. This vast tropical forest is home to millions of species of plants, insects, and animals, many of which are still undiscovered.
questions.question: Which piece of evidence from the text supports the nickname 'lungs of the planet'?
options: It is home to millions of species.
It is a vast tropical forest.
It produces more than 20% of the world's oxygen.
questions.answer: It produces more than 20% of the world's oxygen.

questions.passage: A student is writing an essay arguing that graffiti can be a legitimate art form. Which of the following statements provides the most nuanced and effective claim?
questions.question: Which claim is most nuanced and effective?
options: Graffiti is always a beautiful form of art.
All graffiti should be considered vandalism and removed immediately.
While often associated with vandalism, some graffiti exhibits a high level of artistic skill, social commentary, and cultural significance, deserving consideration as a public art form.
Famous artists like Banksy have created graffiti.
questions.answer: While often associated with vandalism, some graffiti exhibits a high level of artistic skill, social commentary, and cultural significance, deserving consideration as a public art form.

questions.passage: The philosopher's latest work is intentionally abstruse, filled with dense, academic jargon and complex syntactical structures. It seems not to invite understanding so much as to demand it, requiring the reader to engage in a rigorous intellectual struggle to parse its meaning. This is in stark contrast to his earlier, more populist writings which aimed for clarity and broad accessibility.
questions.question: What can be inferred about the philosopher's intentions with his latest work?
options: He is trying to reach a wider, more general audience.
He is targeting a specialized, academic audience willing to do significant intellectual work.
He has simplified his ideas over time.
He no longer believes in the ideas presented in his earlier work.
questions.answer: He is targeting a specialized, academic audience willing to do significant intellectual work.

questions.passage: Last year, my family and I ______ to the Grand Canyon and were amazed by the breathtaking views and the vastness of the landscape.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'panacea' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: The discovery of DNA's double helix structure was a monumental achievement in biology. ______ , it did not immediately reveal how genetic information was copied. It took further research by Meselson and Stahl to demonstrate the semi-conservative replication mechanism, thus completing a major piece of the puzzle.
questions.question: Which choice provides the most logical transition?

questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The experiment yielded a surprising result ______ the compound, which was expected to be inert, reacted vigorously with water.
questions.question: Which choice best corrects the punctuation in the sentence?

questions.passage: The article first defines the concept of 'cognitive dissonance.' It then provides a real-world example of a person buying an expensive item and subsequently seeking out reviews that praise their purchase. Finally, it discusses the psychological mechanisms that drive this behavior.
questions.question: The text is structured to first ______, then ______, and finally ______.
options: provide an example, define a term, discuss mechanisms
define a term, provide an example, discuss mechanisms
discuss mechanisms, define a term, provide an example
provide an example, discuss mechanisms, define a term
questions.answer: define a term, provide an example, discuss mechanisms

questions.passage: In economics, 'moral hazard' describes a situation where one party gets involved in a risky event knowing that it is protected against the risk and the other party will incur the cost. It's a common problem in the insurance industry. For example, if a person has excellent theft insurance for their bicycle, they may be less likely to buy a high-quality lock, knowing that if the bike is stolen, the insurance company will bear the financial loss. This behavioral change increases the likelihood of a negative outcome (theft).
questions.question: Which situation best illustrates the concept of 'moral hazard' as described in the text?
options: A driver with collision insurance who decides to drive more cautiously.
A homeowner who installs a smoke detector after buying fire insurance.
A company with government bailout protection that takes on excessively risky financial investments.
A student who studies harder after seeing a low grade on a test.
questions.answer: A company with government bailout protection that takes on excessively risky financial investments.

questions.passage: After the long hike, the campers were ______, so they quickly set up their tent and prepared a meal.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

questions.passage: A student is writing an essay about the importance of biodiversity. Which of the following would be the most effective thesis statement?
questions.question: Which thesis statement is most effective?
options: Biodiversity is the variety of life on Earth.
There are many different types of animals and plants in the world.

Protecting biodiversity is crucial not only for ecosystem stability and resilience but also for providing essential resources and services, such as clean air, water, and medicine, that are vital to human survival.
Many species are currently facing extinction due to human activities.
questions.answer: Protecting biodiversity is crucial not only for ecosystem stability and resilience but also for providing essential resources and services, such as clean air, water, and medicine, that are vital to human survival.

questions.passage: The list of books, along with the required supplementary articles and online resources, ______ overwhelming to the students at first glance.

questions.passage: The concept of 'opportunity cost' is fundamental to economics. It represents the potential benefits an individual, investor, or business misses out on when choosing one alternative over another. Since resources are finite, every choice involves a trade-off. For example, if you spend two hours and $20 at a movie, you cannot spend that same time studying or that same money on a book. The lost opportunity to study or buy a book is the opportunity cost of seeing the movie.
questions.question: According to the text, what is 'opportunity cost'?
options: The monetary price of an item or service.
The total amount of resources available.
The benefits foregone by choosing one option over another.
A calculation of profit and loss.
questions.answer: The benefits foregone by choosing one option over another.

questions.passage: The politician's speech was a disingenuous attempt to placate the angry crowd, offering vague promises without any concrete plans for action. His words rang hollow to those who had heard similar empty assurances before.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'disingenuous' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: The artist's early work was characterized by vibrant colors and joyful themes. However, following a period of personal tragedy, his palette became muted, and his subject matter turned to themes of loss and isolation. Critics noted that while his later work was somber, it possessed a new, profound depth and emotional resonance that was absent from his earlier, more decorative pieces.
questions.question: What can be inferred about the artist's later work?
options: It was less technically skilled than his early work.
It was more commercially successful than his early work.
It was emotionally deeper and more complex than his early work.
It was a complete rejection of his previous artistic style.
questions.answer: It was emotionally deeper and more complex than his early work.

questions.answer: All of the above are correct.

questions.passage: Climate change poses a significant threat to global food security. Rising temperatures and altered precipitation patterns can lead to crop failures, while ocean acidification harms marine ecosystems and fisheries. To mitigate these risks, a transition to more sustainable agricultural practices and a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions are essential.
questions.question: According to the text, what are two major impacts of climate change on food security?
options: Increased crop yields and healthier oceans.
Crop failures and harm to marine ecosystems.
Lower food prices and greater food availability.
The development of new, climate-resistant crops.
questions.answer: Crop failures and harm to marine ecosystems.

questions.passage: The artist's style underwent a dramatic transformation. Her early canvases were dominated by somber earth tones and rigid, geometric forms. Her later works, however, explode with vibrant, almost chaotic color and fluid, organic shapes. This shift coincided with her move from the stark, urban environment of her youth to a lush, tropical landscape.
questions.question: What can most reasonably be inferred from the text?
options: The artist's early work was more popular with critics.
The artist's change in style was likely influenced by her change in environment.
The artist lost her technical skill over time.
The artist exclusively painted landscapes in her later period.
questions.answer: The artist's change in style was likely influenced by her change in environment.

questions.passage: The defendant provided a seemingly solid alibi for the time of the crime. ______, the prosecution presented new DNA evidence that directly placed him at the scene.

questions.passage: The author opens by stating the commonly held belief that creativity is a rare gift. The subsequent paragraphs, however, methodically debunk this myth by citing studies on neuroplasticity, growth mindset, and the effectiveness of creativity-training techniques. The conclusion reasserts that creativity is a skill accessible to anyone willing to practice.

options: Presenting a popular misconception and then refuting it with evidence
Comparison and contrast of two different theories
questions.answer: Presenting a popular misconception and then refuting it with evidence

options: The movement of the liquid outer core
questions.answer: The movement of the liquid outer core

questions.passage: A student is writing an essay analyzing the theme of ambition in Shakespeare's 'Macbeth'. Which statement would be the most effective and analytical thesis statement for the essay?
questions.question: Which thesis statement is most effective?
options: 'Macbeth' is a play about a Scottish general who becomes king.
Ambition is a major theme in Shakespeare's 'Macbeth'.
In 'Macbeth,' Shakespeare explores the destructive nature of unchecked ambition, portraying it as a corrosive force that inevitably leads to moral decay, psychological torment, and political chaos.
Macbeth and Lady Macbeth are both very ambitious characters.
questions.answer: In 'Macbeth,' Shakespeare explores the destructive nature of unchecked ambition, portraying it as a corrosive force that inevitably leads to moral decay, psychological torment, and political chaos.

questions.passage: The city has recently implemented a bike-sharing program. Stations with bicycles are now available throughout the downtown area, and users can rent a bike for short trips using a mobile app. The city's stated goal is to reduce traffic congestion and encourage healthier lifestyles.
questions.question: Based on the text, which of the following is a likely intended outcome of the bike-sharing program?
options: A decrease in the number of people using public transit.
An increase in physical activity among residents and visitors.
The closure of downtown parking garages.
questions.answer: An increase in physical activity among residents and visitors.

questions.question: As used in the text, what does 'gargantuan' most nearly mean?

questions.passage: Text 1: A recent study suggests that the key to happiness is not the pursuit of grand achievements, but rather the consistent practice of gratitude and mindfulness. Finding joy in small, everyday moments contributes more to life satisfaction than occasional major successes. Text 2: In his book on achieving success, author John Smith argues that setting ambitious, long-term goals is paramount. He claims that true fulfillment comes from striving for and reaching significant personal and professional milestones, which provide a lasting sense of accomplishment.
questions.question: How do the perspectives on fulfillment presented in Text 1 and Text 2 relate to each other?
options: Text 2 provides a specific example of the principles discussed in Text 1.
Text 1 and Text 2 present opposing views on the primary source of fulfillment.
Text 1 critiques the ideas presented by the author in Text 2.
Text 2 offers a more detailed explanation of the concepts introduced in Text 1.
questions.answer: Text 1 and Text 2 present opposing views on the primary source of fulfillment.

questions.passage: The Coriolis effect, a phenomenon caused by the Earth's rotation, significantly influences weather patterns. In the Northern Hemisphere, it deflects moving objects (like wind and ocean currents) to the right, and in the Southern Hemisphere, it deflects them to the left. This effect is responsible for the rotation of large-scale weather systems, such as hurricanes and cyclones.
questions.question: According to the text, what is a direct consequence of the Coriolis effect?
options: The generation of the Earth's magnetic field.
The direction in which large storms spin.
The daily cycle of day and night.
questions.answer: The direction in which large storms spin.

questions.passage: The book was long and complex. ______, it was a rewarding read that offered deep insights into the subject.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

questions.passage: The artist finished her painting, she felt a sense of accomplishment.
questions.question: Which revision best corrects the comma splice in the sentence?
options: The artist finished her painting, and she felt a sense of accomplishment.
After the artist finished her painting, she felt a sense of accomplishment.
The artist finished her painting; she felt a sense of accomplishment.
All of the above are correct.
questions.answer: All of the above are correct.

questions.passage: The documentary's attempt to present a balanced view was commendable; however, by giving equal airtime to a fringe conspiracy theory alongside established scientific fact, it inadvertently created a false ______.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

questions.passage: Next summer, my friends and I ______ to Europe for a backpacking trip.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The CEO's speech was more of a diatribe than a constructive address, filled with angry accusations and devoid of any solutions.
questions.question: As used in the text, 'diatribe' most nearly means

questions.passage: The study found that subjects who slept for eight hours performed significantly better on cognitive tests than those who slept for only six. The six-hour group showed slower reaction times and a higher rate of errors on memory-based tasks.
questions.question: What can be inferred from the text?
options: Six hours of sleep is sufficient for most people.
Sleep deprivation can negatively impact cognitive performance.
Eight hours is the maximum amount of sleep a person should get.
questions.answer: Sleep deprivation can negatively impact cognitive performance.

questions.passage: The Eiffel Tower was constructed from 1887 to 1889 as the centerpiece of the 1889 World's Fair. Initially criticized by some of France's leading artists and intellectuals for its design, it has since become a global cultural icon of France and one of the most recognizable structures in the world.
questions.question: What was the original purpose of the Eiffel Tower?
options: To be a permanent monument in Paris.
To serve as a radio transmission tower.
To be the entrance to the 1889 World's Fair.
To be a military observation post.
questions.answer: To be the entrance to the 1889 World's Fair.

questions.passage: A student is writing an essay arguing for the preservation of historical buildings. Which statement most effectively frames the argument in a way that addresses potential counterarguments about cost?
questions.question: Which statement is most effective?
options: Old buildings should be saved because they are pretty.
Destroying historical buildings is like erasing our past.

While the restoration of historical buildings can be costly, the long-term cultural, educational, and economic benefitssuch as tourism and a unique community identityoften outweigh the initial investment.
It is too expensive to maintain old buildings, so they should be replaced with modern, efficient structures.
questions.answer: While the restoration of historical buildings can be costly, the long-term cultural, educational, and economic benefitssuch as tourism and a unique community identityoften outweigh the initial investment.

questions.passage: A key part of the ecosystem, the mangrove forests ______ as a crucial nursery for many marine species and protect the coastline from erosion.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The team celebrated its victory ______ a hard-fought game.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.passage: The artist Georgia O'Keeffe is renowned for her paintings of enlarged flowers, New York skyscrapers, and New Mexico landscapes. A central theme in her work is the close observation of nature, finding abstract forms and monumental grandeur in objects both large and small. She famously said, 'I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other waythings I had no words for.'
questions.question: Which choice from the text best illustrates O'Keeffe's artistic philosophy?
options: She is renowned for her paintings of enlarged flowers.
Her work includes New York skyscrapers and New Mexico landscapes.
She could say things with color and shapes that she had no words for.
A central theme in her work is the close observation of nature.
questions.answer: She could say things with color and shapes that she had no words for.
